page.title: 05EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES
page.content: There are several institutions of education in our area. Our own, Clermiston Primary, takes children from the local area from the age of four and a half for seven years when they move on to Secondary education. There is also a nursery department where they can begin at three years. Other Primary schools in the area are Corstorphine, Drumbrae, East Craigs and Gylemuir. The oldest Primary school in our area is Corstorphine, a large, stone-built structure. East Craigs is the newest, being modern open-plan design instead of individual classrooms. Craigmount High is the only Secondary school, but there is an important college, Queen Margaret College, which trains people for posts in speech therapy, physiotherapy, dietetics, home economics etc.
